selected_quotes: Decoding Bach's The Art of the Fugue.
Bach would never have envisaged a public rendition of of his fugues, much less a performance of the complete work
The Art of Fugue is high art. But it also contains pathos, humour, gravity, exuberance tragedy. @TheConversation
The moral quandary w/ Bach's last work The Art of Fugue: Daniel Herscovitch lecture+recital today 2-4pm at Monash
Bach y el arte de la Fuga. (Artículo en Inglés).

citation.abstract: Johann Sebastian Bach's The Art of Fugue is a work of high art. But in keeping with the late works of artists such as Shakespeare, Beethoven and Goya, it contains elements of pathos, humour, gravity, exuberance and tragedy.
citation.title: Decoding the music masterpieces: Bach's The Art of Fugue

news.title: Decoding the music masterpieces: Liszt’s Piano Sonata in B minor
news.summary: Clara Schumann, the wife of the great composer Robert Schumann, wrote in her diary on 25 May 1854: Liszt sent Robert today a sonata dedicated to him and several other things with a friendly letter to me.

news.title: Decoding Bach's Art of Fugue
news.summary: Bach's Art of Fugue is one of his more mysterious works, he left it incomplete and with unspecified instrumentation, two things which have caused much debate among performers, musicologists and historians.

news.title: Decoding the music masterpieces: Bach's The Art of Fugue
news.summary: Posted July 02, 2017 10:00:00 In the last decade of his life, from 1740 to 1750, Johann Sebastian Bach abandoned the furious pace of composition he had maintained for over 30 years and concentrated his creative energies largely on the composition of…

news.title: Birdsong has inspired humans for centuries: is it music?
news.summary: On my first trip to Australia from Paris, I heard a pied butcherbird vocalising on a remote sheep station.

news.title: Birdsong has inspired humans for centuries, but is it music?
news.summary: 40 minutes ago Hollis Taylor, The Conversation Share Tweet Email Reddit Print Share Tweet Email Reddit Print On my first trip to Australia from Paris, I heard a pied butcherbird vocalising on a remote sheep station.
